Game works well but can‚Äôt change the difficulties every time switch to hard it switch back to medium writes ......

title.label: Game is incredible but needs something more

content.label:
Ok I'm going to start out with the things I love about the game and as someone who has played the game for years and bought all the dlc content I know this game pretty well

Ok so first of the water is insane it's to satisfying to watch the boat rock and bob as it cuts through the water and the combat is incredibly fun and easy to master the quests are fun varied and engaging along with the occasional leviathan encounter (that I wish would happen more often) making this game one of my favorite games ever and that says a lot considering I play way to many video games 

Ok with all the grate work the developers have pout into this master peace I think there are a few changes that could really improve the game 
First off the grim reaper quest is cool and the ship is awsome I love the idea of special boats only obtained by random things like that more please
Second I find myself annoyed by the fact that you cant see prices or stats for items in the where to buy tab and adding this would save me hours of just sailing to every port to find the best items I can buy
Third I already mentioned this but I feel the sea monster encounters should happen a lot more becaus I rarely see them and haven't seen one in a very long time and the model the developers made is soo cool for every sing monster wether it be the crab, sea unicorn, leviathan, or the kraken 
Fourth I think that the portals between waters can be a bit of a interruption in the games smooth wonderful flow so I think mabey there could be a feature that allows the player to look at the different maps while being in a different map (such as being in the calm waters and looking at the goatsly seas map) and set a waypoint in that map that will caus the ship to sail to the portal use it without exiting the map and go to the goastly seas and then go to the way point if that makes sense 
Fifth I kinda want a co-op mode where you can trade, do missions with, and give other players items but what we have now is really cool to
Not to forget the one thing I hate about the game and that is the melee combats it's ok on boarding but on islands and stuff it's absolutely atrocious you can destroyed faster than you can blink and with the 5 on one scenarios with no helth regen or anything to buff you you get just shot to death my record for fastest death is about 2 seconds so far but mabey buffing your defense or mabey adding new swords or armor and artifacts for your person would make it more possible becaus I just can't fight 5 guys with guns at one
If anything I would really like to see the suggested changes made and added to the game but all I really care about is that the developers know I love this game and appreciate every second they spent on this incredible experience

Been a fan of this game for years now love it all 
, just one problem the new full version I been noticing i can‚Äôt change my difficulty. It‚Äôs permanently on Medium.

title.label: Would be great, if not for MAJOR bug and bad ad placement

content.label: The game would be pretty great (only reason it got two), IF it were not for a serious flaw in game controls that the developers seems unwilling or unable to fix. The camera view and movement controls glitch so the movement starts to control the camera view, and NOTHING controls the movement. You have to stop touching the screen for a second to get it all to reset, and in any close battle, especially in the 3rd person player mode where you run around with a sword, it will cause you to die, A LOT. Such a shame! On top of that, the advertisements for expansions and boost packs randomly appear the top of the main sailing gameplay screen, larger than any other icons on the screen, no way to hide them I can find, and when tacked on next to the normal icons, they block the top left part of the screen pretty well, which is no good. Sell things when players log on or go to menus, NOT in the middle of gameplay.

title.label: The DLC is just so so

content.label:
The title of this comment is a bit of unfair for this great game. However, I just want to say the land mode in this game is in sharp contrast with the sea mode which is awesome. I think this is ok since the game features pirates and overseas trading. However, since it does involve activity inlands, I have a few comments on that:
1. The graphics is not great but acceptable since this is after all a game on phone, so although I still point this out but I‚Äôm not complaining on that.
2. Compared to its relatively boring graphics and storyline, land missions in this game are too difficult. It‚Äôs not fun at all failing over a last-century style/quality game. Maybe this whole DLC is still under-developing, but still, for its quality it‚Äôs too hard. For example, the Emperor‚Äôs daughter mission is too long to finish and your character too easily killed(It doesn‚Äôt make any sense that none of his crew would follow and help him ashore, just as in sea battles.) also you spend really too much time just killing irrelevant zombies and have to tighten up your nerves every time handling these supposedly trivial obstacles just because each of them can be insanely fatal. I mean why should I keep playing a series of boss fights before I even reach a minor step in the whole mission? All of these problems are aggravated by the fact that land missions are of low quality and too crude. 
The main part of the game is awesome and really fun. But the land missions are just trash and I couldn‚Äôt believe I paid for it.
